meanings.definition: A word, phrase, or sentence formed by the first letters of a series of lines in a poem or other text.
meanings.sent1: In the poetry class, we learned about a telestich where the first letters of each line spelled out a secret message.
meanings.sent2: The telestich at the end of the poem revealed a hidden meaning that surprised the readers.
meanings.sent3: The telestich in the story was like a puzzle waiting to be solved by the clever detective.
meanings.sent4: Her telestich of love was woven into the fabric of her heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent5: The telestich in the ancient scroll held the key to unlocking the mystery of the lost city.

meanings.definition: A type of acrostic in which the last letters of a series of lines spell out a word or message.
meanings.sent1: The telestich in the song spelled out a secret word when the last letters were read together.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the players deciphered the telestich hidden in the riddle.
meanings.sent3: The telestich at the end of the letter was like a surprise waiting to be discovered by the recipient.
meanings.sent4: His telestich of hope shone brightly in the darkness of despair.
meanings.sent5: The telestich in the ancient manuscript revealed the name of the lost king when decoded.
